description: I am using Latex by ages, with Texworks, Tex Studio and the online Overleaf. The tool has potential and integrates very well with Gnome, but the compilation is the worst ever seen : 1. Poor options, you cannot select many compilers 2. you cannot compile only the bibliography 3. most of the time doesn´t read your bibliography correctly read and compiled by other tools, and doesn´t export the tex in docx as other tool do nowadays. I thought was a promising tool but is not ready for the real world. Furthemore the Flatpack has only one compiler working and most of the time crashes, the rpm version of the fedora repository works better, but with no dynamic theming and furthermore requires to install all the latex library to be ready to use, but there is no warning about it. I am sorry, but there is a lot of work to do.
Does everything I want to do with a nice UI.

Great peice of software. Thx !
I created latex files with Gummie (for me the best latex editor until yours). My files are compatible with pretty much all the latex editors. But with Setzer I cannot see my figures on the generated pdf file. I can only see empty squares. Any idea?
Also suggestion for future updates : create an option for a live auto-generated pdf file, "à la" Gummie. This is 2019 and I reckon this should be the way to go. In any case Setzer is likely to become the best piece of sotware in the yard. Keep up the good work ! PS : why not changing the software icon and give another more explicit name.
I've been using Setzer daily for weeks. Hits the right balance between holding your hand and leaving you with nothing but a text editor. ?
summary: Straight up the best, by far

description: Definitely recommend. It's still need some works. But overall great app
It is too nice. This is the latex editor of my dreams.
Setzer is a beautiful and functional LaTeX editor. I tried a number of the suggested editors but Setzer is by far the best. I think I'll be sticking with Setzer for the long haul!

I like to use the moderncv LaTeX template for my resume, and Setzer is the only straightforward way I have found to easily edit, compile, use packages; all the other LaTeX tasks in a GNU/Linux OS. Hats off to the developer(s)!
Just like title, exactly what I was looking for as a beginner latex user

There is no way to disable automatic closing brackets. This is VERY annoying when typing lots of equations because they have A LOT OF { }. It automatically adds closing brace } but to exit it, one may intuitively press } again, which works in vscode, atom, overleaf, or any other nice editor, but not here! It would add a second closing brace }. So, one has to take their hands off the home row to the arrow keys or the mouse to exit the brackets. This might be useful for people who don't know how to type, but for everyone else, it is enough to uninstall this app.
summary: Great app, but has one annoying problem

description: With gnome-latex not available in Fedora 35, I tried installing Setzer. The interface is simple but elegant and fits in well with the GNOME feel. However, when trying to use it on my existing latex document, I found its options for building file a bit lacking. I still use the tex -> dvi -> ps -> pdf build path since I rely on packages such as psfrag, but there is no option to customise the build. There is only Xelatex, pdflatex, and lualatex. So they all came up with errors (unable to load in eps graphics) or psfrag simply not working. It is quite a shame since it is near perfect in other ways. If they can add some more options to customise the build process so that we can include a postscript build (which is easy since they have an option to use latexmk), this would be perfect.
summary: Very nice interface but lacking build options

description: This is the first LaTeX-editor that really makes me want to use LaTeX! Thank you for the great work on the UX! Loving the "New Document Wizard" and the clean interface. Keep up the good work!
debian 11.6 update
summary: I cannot open the setzer after installing it

description: Excellent LaTeX editor, honestly really impressed with the quality.

i was trying it for 15 minutes and everything just works. had to download some packages with dnf for my language support, but everything else worked out of the box. and the gui is just georgous - any other latex editor looks so bloated. i hope it gets more recognition. i also starred your project on github. would be good to see color theme editor tho
summary: definitely the most minimal latex editor out there

description:
This is a very good editor for LaTeX documents. As a beginner, it helped me get started but now when I'm a bit more self-sufficient it doesn't get in the way. I use Vim for most text-editing tasks but I think it'll be quite a while before i switch from Setzer for my math documents.

The only issue I've had is with some occasional crashes, but they're not very frequent. Also the startup time could be quicker but once started it's very responsive.
It's so fast and nice looking compared to other LaTex Editors. The interface is simple, yet powerful.
I like the minimal UI and preview system
Bestes LaTex-GUI für GNOME
Simple y directo. Se acopla muy bien a gnome. Por ahora no me ha dado fallos pero si tarda un poco más que otros editores para compilar.

La aplicación es bastante buena y posee recursos que me parecieron exclusivos y útiles. Sin embargo, no es completo, pues le faltan funciones, especialmente corrector ortográfico. De cualquier modo, lo recomiendo.
good application
Application très complète et parfaitement fonctionnelle. Le tout avec une interface graphique très agréable !

When I tup to label programm don't start. 
Kubuntu 22.04
简洁强大，在gnome里非常顺手
